lines.gurmukhi: jYsy aulU Awidq audoiq joiq kau n jwny Awn dyv syvkY n sUJY swDsMg mY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Uloo Aadit Udoti Joti Kau N Jaanay , Aan Dayv Sayvakai N Soojhai Saadhasang Mai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as an owl cannot know the greatness of sunlight, similarly a worshipper of other deities cannot have perception of True Guru's advice and company of the holy men.

lines.gurmukhi: mrkt mn mwink mihmw n jwny Awn dyv syvk n sbdu pRsMg mY
lines.transliteration_english: Marakat Man Maanik Mahimaa N Jaanay , Aan Dayv Sayvak N Sabadu Prasang Mai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a monkey does not know the value of pearls and diamonds, so can a follower of other deities not assess the importance of Guru's sermon.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau PinMdR pY pwT mhwqmY n jwnY Awn dyv syvk mhwpRswid AMg mY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Dhanindr Pai Paatth Mahaatamai N Jaanai , Aan Dayv Sayvak Mahaaprasaadi Ang Mai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a cobra cannot appreciate nectar-like milk, similarly a follower of other gods cannot understand significance of the blessings of the Guru's word and his consecrated gift of Karhah Parsad.

lines.gurmukhi: ibnu hMs bMs bg Tg n skq itk Agm AgwiD suK swgr qrMg mY ]453]
lines.transliteration_english: Binu Hans Bans Bag Tthag N Sakat Tika , Agam Agaadhi Soukh Saagar Tarang Mai ?453?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as an egret cannot fit in the flock of swans and has no knowledge of comforting waves of lake Mansarover. Similarly a worshipper (follower) of other gods cannot stay in the society of devout Sikhs blessed by the True Guru, nor can he understand the d
